claim: You can watch the Borgia's World of Wonders before Ludacris's Release Therapy finishes.

supporting.text: The Borgia's World of Wonders is a shorter production than Ludacris's Release Therapy, making it possible to watch before the album finishes.

attacks.text: The Borgia's World of Wonders is a shorter production than Ludacris's Release Therapy, making it possible to watch before the album finishes.
The Borgia's World of Wonders may have a longer runtime if including bonus features or extended editions, making it potentially longer than Release Therapy.
Standard editions of The Borgia's World of Wonders are consistently shorter than Release Therapy, and bonus features are not part of the main runtime.
Release Therapy may be played at a faster speed or with skipped tracks, reducing its effective duration below that of The Borgia's World of Wonders.
Playing Release Therapy at an altered speed or skipping tracks deviates from the standard listening experience and is not a fair comparison.

supporting.text: Release Therapy is a lengthy album, and Borgia's World of Wonders could be a brief show, allowing time to watch it before the album ends.

attacks.text: Release Therapy is a lengthy album, and Borgia's World of Wonders could be a brief show, allowing time to watch it before the album ends.

Even if Release Therapy is standard in length, Borgia's World of Wonders could still be significantly shorter than average, allowing it to fit within the album's runtime.
Borgia's World of Wonders is not brief; it is a full-length feature or series, making it impossible to watch before Release Therapy finishes.
There is no verified information about the runtime of Borgia's World of Wonders, so the assumption that it is brief is speculative.

Significant delays are unlikely under normal viewing conditions.
